content.description: A cell’s membrane potential is maintained by the movement of ions into and out of the cell. A model showing the influence of membrane proteins on the movement of sodium (<math alttext="N a plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>) and potassium (<math alttext="K plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext></mtext><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>) ions across the plasma membrane is presented in Figure 1.
content.question: Figure 1. Section of a cell’s plasma membrane, showing ion concentrations and membrane proteins Based on the model presented in Figure 1, which of the following outcomes will most likely result from a loss of protein <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> function?

choices.label: The membrane potential will be disrupted by an increase in <math alttext="N a plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration inside the cell.

The membrane potential will be disrupted by an increase in <math alttext="K plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration inside the cell.

The membrane potential will be maintained by the <math alttext="N a plus, K plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext></mtext><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mo>−</mo><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext></mtext><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> pump moving more <math alttext="K plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext></mtext><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions into the cell.

The membrane potential will be maintained by the diffusion of <math alttext="N a plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext></mtext><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions into the cell.

content.answer: The membrane potential will be disrupted by an increase in <math alttext="K plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration inside the cell.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
